rounds.category: LET'S HEAR IT FOR ANIMAL MOMS

clues.text: Dad must be relieved when mom of the Emperor species of this returns from a long trek to the ocean & regurgitates fish for the chick
This time period, from the Latin for "carrying", can test any mom's patience: for an elephant, it can be 22 months & an octopus, 53
Talk about a passel of kids--this North American marsupial can give birth to as many as 20 babies at a time, each no larger than a bee
Hens dissolve their own bones if needed to get this element to make shells for their young
Aphids can produce young through this "virgin birth" method with no mating & produce pregnant babies holding more young
3 letters, dealing with numbers; an exam section for it is called auditing & attestation; the exam itself takes 16 hours
A work crew leader; a jury leader (less remunerative)
Field general; millions look at every move you make... & critique it; Otto Graham & Russell Wilson, good examples
Knows the proper use of propofol; can count to 16 (letters in the job); can tell people to count backward from 100
There's a fluid specific to your specific job; applying makeup can be part of it; preserving more than dignity
Arkansas Gov. James Miller was once famous for his quote, "I will try, sir!" during this early 19th century war
In 1941 its governor, Joseph Poindexter, protested the transfer of some of the Pacific Fleet to the Atlantic
Before his brief time as U.S. president, he served 12 years as governor of the Indiana Territory
Frank Franz served as an Indian agent of the Osage Agency before becoming this territory's last governor in 1906
Florida Gov. William Pope Duval tried to be fair to these people; the wars named for them were before & after his 1822-1834 tenure
She dedicated "Frankenstein" to her father William Godwin
Called "zippy, zesty, and zotty", this debut novel cooked up by Bonnie Garmus became a streaming series starring Brie Larson
You can breathe easier knowing that Terry McMillan wrote a sequel to this novel called "Getting to Happy"
Joan Didion established her reputation as an essayist with her 1968 collection "Slouching Towards" this place
In a letter to pen pal across the sea Harriet Beecher Stowe, she discussed her own novel "Daniel Deronda"

Barnyard bovid:
TOGA

Plated for protection:
RADIO MALL

Popular pet:
AMHERST

Horny herbivore:
CHOIR SNORE

Aquatic & endangered:
EMANATE
Whether your cart is full of its Kirkland Signature goods or not, you'll have to show your receipt when exiting this store
Keep your receipts! In this 2-word arrangement in which an employer pays for lunches & such; Pete Campbell on "Mad Men" had one
Ancient receipts for sacrifices are preserved on this material from a water plant--could your Wendy's receipt be museum bound?
You can get a donation receipt for gifts to worthy causes like this Memphis hospital fighting pediatric cancer since 1962
Receipts can be uploaded, speedily of course, to this Intuit service to let business owners track finances
Queen Mary docked with the throne in 1553 but set sail for the hereafter in 1558, & a new age dawned with this royal
In 1940 he became chief of the NAACP Legal Defense & Educational Fund; 27 years later, he became a supreme authority
The sequence of U.S. vice presidents goes Breckinridge, Hannibal Hamlin, this man but tragedy saw him serve only a few weeks
A major war began in 1618 & ended with the Peace of Westphalia in this year; know the event, do the math & you're home
This began in 1934 & would cross 18 mountain ranges & 24 rivers before reaching Shaanxi province the following year
Schwarzenegger made his film debut as this strongman of myth "in New York" but his voice didn't--Arnold got dubbed over by an American
Pre-"Sherlock", he had an early role on British TV as Rory Slippery on "Fortysomething"
Her 1st IMDb credit is for "Married... with Children"; she then checked in to "General Hospital" but eventually, she made a royal exit
Set in the Aussie Outback, 1983's "Bush Christmas" was the feature film debut of this Oscar-winning actress
Showbiz is easy! Anna Paquin won an Oscar for her first screen role in this 1993 film & was instrumental to its success
In 1949 "Le Combat" was first performed as an extended one of these French-named ballet dances for 2 performers
This Scottish folk song about "my Bonnie" may actually be about royal pretender Prince Charlie
"The sun shines bright" on this Stephen Foster tune written in the 1850s & designated a state song in 1928
Moving to music in 2/4 time with 3 quick steps & a hop, this lively Bohemian folk dance can be seen in Smetana's "The Bartered Bride"
On Nov. 26, 1945 this saxophone great recorded "Ko Ko" with Dizzy Gillespie & a teenaged Miles Davis
Tourists in this Jamaican capital may want to visit the Bob Marley Museum & Liberty Hall, a museum devoted to Marcus Garvey
The Almendares River traverses this Caribbean capital & empties into the Straits of Florida
Gustavia, capital of Saint Barts, was named for this country's King Gustav III
This capital of the U.S. Virgin Islands was founded in 1666 as Taphus, Danish for "beer hall"
In 1749 the French laid out this capital in a grid pattern around a port called L'Hopital
A man cuckolds himself in "The Man Who Was Recklessly Curious", which is read by a priest in this Cervantes work
In this collection, "The Porter & the 3 Ladies of Baghdad" leads to "The First Kalandar's Tale", which leads to even more stories
clues.response: A Thousand and One Nights (The Arabian Nights)

clues.text: Taking 5 from a whale tale, in "The Town-Ho's Story" this narrator tells of a mutiny while smoking with some buds in Lima, Peru
In a story within this 1880 Russian novel, Ivan tells his sibling Alyosha a tale about Jesus & the Grand Inquisitor in Spain
The postmodern "The Crying of Lot 49" includes a summary of a fake revenge play from this literary era that began in 1603

rounds.text: Yale takes credit for starting a commencement tradition when it gave this composer an honorary doctorate in 1905
